I saw Transformers last weekend. They definitely made a good movie, even though they did reinvent quite a bit. With ever changing technology, it's understandable why they would, and I don't think it takes too much from the movie. I guess it's part of the nostalgic 80s child who wishes they could have left some things alone. Prime is the wrong kind of semi, and his paint job is a little over the top; he looks like something you'd see as a carnival. He is voiced by Peter Cullen, the original voice actor, so I give that a major plus. 
I don't mind Bumblebee being a Camero so much, especially since they did reference his old form (he's parked next to an old Volkswagen Beetle at the beginning) and they made it quite clear that he can update his form when he chooses.  My main objection was that Devastator was a tank, instead of being the giant robot formed by all the Constructicons. What gives..? If they're gonna get lazy with certain characters, they might as well replace him with a smaller, easier character to deal with
There were a few cheesy parts as well, like when the robots are waiting outside the boy's house. I can definitely see the need for humor, but I think some of the cheesiness could have been omitted, or toned down.  It would leave time for more important things, and reduce the amount of groans from the audience. 
The CG effects were just amazing, even if the characters weren't all true to original form.  I expect they'll be even more impressive in the sequel. 
Overall, I think the movie succeeded, and I'm sure the sequel will be even better. I hope they'll decide to go back and use some more elements from Generation One, and not reinvent too much more...

Why do some people have to go out of their way to make trouble for others? I mean, since I started this job, I've stuck to my work, only engaged in casual chit-chat, and NEVER ONCE have I pursued interest in anyone. Yet, this one girl decided to report me, and use this 'zero tolarence' bullshit against me. WTF? Most of the conversations I've had with her were ones she instigated, and, when I'd go to buy food she'd be the one joking around. I've never had, nor shown, any interest in her, especially since she's married, yet somehow I got accused of asking her what she was doing one night? and staring.. oh man, I was looking around the breakroom during work, simply minding my surroundings, and she's gonna start freaking out because she thinks I'm staring at her. I basically ignored her then, yet I still had to be called into the office.
I sometimes wonder what's happening to our society. Have we all digressed to kindergartners, where we can "tell on" someone simply because we somehow get some deranged, not to mention, the WRONG, ideas in our heads about somebody? I often think things would be simpler if they were handled the old fashioned way. Send someone to fight me outside of work; at least that way I could fight back, and not put my job on the line.
